messages.subject: Things wot I'll miss...was Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: shyrley's  bitchin'
messages.msgSnippet: ... Dishwashers are pretty expensive back home. I only ever knew one family who had one. It was so novel I even offered to load it for her! Plus the water is
messages.messageBody:
Tia Leschke wrote:

> > << While
> > dh has a good job now, why not save money for a dishwasher and the
> > money to ship it. Maybe you can let it sit at your mom's house? >>
> >
> > They couldn't hook it up or plug it in.
> >
> > Appliances and electricity and cabinets and plumbing are all different
> there.
>
> Are they simply not available there, or do you just have to buy them there
> and they're expensive. If that were the case, Shyrley could save the money
> while here to buy there.
> Tia
>

Dishwashers are pretty expensive back home. I only ever knew one family who had one. It was so novel I even offered to load it for her! Plus the water is metered and a dishwasher used more than a
washing-up bowl in the sink.
You know what else I'll miss? The garbage disposal! We don't have them at all. Aren't they fun? I could spend ages playing with one (and have done...) It's like having a sharrk in the sink :-)

And could we change the headings now please. Its getting a bit disconcerting!

Shyrley
